Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole!”
Reviews.Author: JTroadtripusa
Reviews.Content: I should have known not to stay here when the receptionist told me hed give me a better rate If I slipped him a twenty which i did not do. Secondly, I asked why there were no other quests when the more expensive hotel next door was charging twice as much and had only two rooms left on a holiday weekend. Please do not stay here. It is only cheap for a reason. The lobby gives a false sense of reality. It seems classy and a bargin. After paying, I noticed immediately made a mistake. Trash was overflowing from trash cans. Smell of marijuana in the halls. Other terrible oder spread throughout the hotel and rooms. Blood and the hair on the bedsheets. Staff unfriendliest people I have ever meet at a hotel. Terrible terrible experience for someone who has frequented hostels, slept on trains and hundreds of hotels around the world. We were on a budget and decided to go next door and pay twice as much for only a nights stay. Also, I noticed the doors were not locked on the sides. Although we were not PLEASE take note if your a parent for safety reasons.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...and maybe some pleasant surprises.”
Reviews.Author: ladyonfire
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed the night on our way to New Orleans, LA for Mardi Gras. It was the halfway point of where we were coming from and where we were going, so we were all pretty exhausted and annoyed with one another by the time we arrived to the hotel (which was a little difficult to get to, being right off of a crazy busy multiple lane, seriously congested freeway with exits on both sides of the freeway *which is strange coming from a place that only has exits on one side*). When we checked in, the girl at the desk seemed a bit bored with the mundane details of her job (i.e. typing my surname into the computer and giving me the hotel key). She barely spoke English, which generally I didn't mind but I had a few questions I needed answering, and she was having a lot of trouble understanding me and vice versa. We got to our room, and was surprised by how clean, sizable, and comfy it was. The beds were stacked with the fluffiest, most delightful pillows, the beds were shockingly well put together, clean, and the sheets were soft. The bathroom was spotless (which is rare in a budget hotel), and everything was in fine working order. The free continental breakfast was surprisingly delicious, there were a ton of options, and everything seemed quite fresh and tasty. All in all, as stated in the title, you get what you pay for, and some little pleasant surprises. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who's not a hotel snob looking for a decently priced hotel that's clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Massive amounts of maintenance needed and a good cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: clarence172000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap and the breakfast was ok (I'm not very discriminatory on any food any where). This hotel needed tons of maintenance. Our room entry way light was burned out making our room very dark. The door handle for the closet fell off. The chair to the room desk was broken, the arm rest was nearly falling off. The door adjoining the neighboring room would not lock. Also, the carpet hallway carpet throughout the building was dingy and smelly. The bathrooms were disgustingly dirty and often had no toilet paper. The tables in breakfast dining area were wobbly and the milk smelled sour. One other thing to note, the walls are paper thin. We could hear people talking in the hallway and our neighbors TV even though neither were at unreasonable volumes. Finally, I called down to the front desk to find out when breakfast was served 3 times and no one ever answered. I left a message and it was not returned. Staff had very few suggestions for local, "off the beaten path", restaurants or attractions. If you are looking for cheap, suspect cleanliness, and not very good customer service then go hear. This totally served our purpose for this trip. If you are looking for nice, or even just descent, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: iJayRock
Reviews.Content: The hotel was horrible. The front desk staff was rude and even tried to cheat me out of my quoted rate and tried to over charge me for pocket change. The breakfast was disgusting. The rooms were dirty and smelled terrible. The hallway down on the first floor smelled like "Marijuana", the buisness center didn't work because "there was a virus on the computer". It was creepy and ugly!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great staffs. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: john2009_10
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was a great experience. Front desk, house keeping and all the staffs were very friendly and were very welcoming. The breakfast they have is the best one can get in a hotel and its a nice way to start the day. The rooms were clean, front desk clerk was very helpful and cheerful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased withour stay!”
Reviews.Author: kittyconni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take our children to Dallas for the weekend. I looked on a coupon site and found a 49.99 coupon for this hotel. He told me not to expect much for that price, but I wanted to try it out anyway. We got there and were very impressed with the cleanliness of the lobby and the very nice hotel front desk staff. The room was nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable!! Their hotel and spa were clean as well and the kids had a great time swimming. We were looking for a nearby walmart to find some things we had forgotten to pack (like my swimsuit) and the desk clerk was so nice! He even printed out directions for us. The breakfast was hot and great! Eggs, sausage, waffles, homefries, cereal...too much to list! Anytime my family and I travel to Dallas, TX, we will stay at this hotel! Thank you for a wonderful weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Location and price”
Reviews.Author: atatuatu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for half a week in October of 2009 and came back for two weeks in March of 2010. Got a good rate for the week long stays. Cleanliness and condition of rooms were fine, not ultra luxury, but on target for the price level of this hotel. Breakfasts were better than average and we always easily found someone to replenish supplies. The group having their breakfast one morning was interesting and did not cause any problems as stated by another reviewer. I would be happy to return to this hotel in future. It is very much centrally located which is great if you need to do things all over the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: breesong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn Conference Center for one evening with a large group of approximately 40 people. Minnie, the Sales Director, was extremely helpful and provided a great customer service experience that exceeded expectations. Once I arrived with my large group, the staff on site were also very helpful. The location of the hotel is great, (right off of the LBJ freeway), and the full hot breakfast did not disappoint. I was inclined to stay at the Quality Inn Conference Center because of the ballroom meeting space which I needed for my Friday night conference, as well as the great service I experienced prior to my arrival. After my trip, I am not ashamed to say that Quality Inn certainly did deliver. I would not hesitate to bring my group there again for another stay. And I would definitely recommend staying at the Quality Inn Conference Center for anyone needing a place to stay in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: louiscapo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a couple days while on business and found it to be a great value and convenient to the city.

Reviews.Title: “wierd and smelly”
Reviews.Author: wcoaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very bizarre. A large site with four wings of hotel, half of which were Quality Inn and half of the same property was La Quinta. The Quality Inn side had the sad quality of an abandoned hotel--dark, smelly, and wierdly decorated. The marquee and the web site promised "all new rooms" but my room was stark, the bedspred was stained, the sofa was warn and smelled bad, the coffee table had a big white paint smudge on the top. No ice in the icemaker. Lots of strange young men loitering around talking on cell phones in the hallways, outside the doors (drug dealers? pimps? did not seem like legit business men)

Reviews.Title: “No Quality in this Inn”
Reviews.Author: houstongal43
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of booking this hotel without consulting Trip Advisor. I did this once before with the same outcome.....it was terrible! The hotel advertises "New Rooms" and we did note new paint (which was splattered all over the light fixtures, mirrors, floors & electrical plugs) and possibly a new bathtub. Also, the carpet looked fairly new. Other than that.....one of the bedspreads had a cigarette burn all the way through it, the drapes were dirty, the bathroom floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned (blood droplets on the floor!) and the hallways in the hotel smelled musty. I was, however surprised at the nice breakfast they provided - scrambled eggs, sausage, breakfast potatoes, waffles, etc. The waffle machine was out of mix, so my husband had to go to the hotel's kitchen to find someone to help. He said the staff was just sitting around in the kitchen doing nothing. When someone did finally come out to refill the machine, my husband had to ask him to empty the trash, which was overflowing. There was a group there having breakfast together (they had their own breakfast buffet) and there were no signs to let regular patrons know that that buffet belonged to the group. You can imagine my embarassment when I ventured over to see if the other buffet had bacon and was told that I was intruding on the group's meeting! Also, as my husband and I ate breakfast, we had to listen to the group as they held their meeting (with a portable speaker/microphone). I will never go back to this hotel and I advised all readers to stay away. I'm surprised the Choice Hotels chain runs this place!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladybug103
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were given the key to our room and a man with a cast on told me where my room was located. the girl at the counter had given me my room number and spoke it out loudly. I went to my room only to discover the beds were not made. I went back to the front desk, the clerk apologized and gave me new keys to a different room. I asked the man who was still hanging around the front desk if he worked there. He said no but he had been helping out as he had stayed there a long time. At least I felt that he was harmless (I don't think it is a good idea for the hotel clerk to give you your room number and have others be able to hear it) any way the next room was 178 and the lock to the next room was not working. I found several dead roaches ( I call them tree roaches) at least they were dead!!!! We checked our bed no roaches (the south has alot of roaches and when they are this big and dead it is at least a sign the hotel is spraying for them) The next morning roach in bed dead----ugh!!!! the worst was yet to come---no hot water to shower. I complained to the front desk--- nice young women, no manager on site, all they could do is say sorry. Really this place needs more than a clean up--something is seriously wrong here (in my opinion) do not stay here---this is not like other quality inns.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service broken down pit”
Reviews.Author: jshlen123
Reviews.Content: elevators broke beer bottles all over hallways,,,wrong room key given to occupied room, pool out of order hot tub broke, tile broken bath dirty no t.v. remote....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: veronica1234
Reviews.Content: We first walked in and the main elevators were broken. We had to use the side elevators that closed on you if you did not RUN into and out of. We had four people staying in the room but only got 2 towels. When the front desk was called to ask for 2 more towels they said we had to return the dirty towels first before they could give us 2 more!!! The paint and wallpaper were peeling off the walls. We had a yellow jacket in our room that we had to kill. The side door that was supposed to be locked at all times was propped open with a board (not very safe). We went down to the complimentary breakfast but could not stomach eating the food. The milk was expired by 7 DAYS!! No thank you! We stayed 2 nights. On our last night they had rented out a party room on the same floor. We were woken up at 2:30 am to screaming kids! We called the front desk and she said she would see what she could do. Needless to say, we checked out at 4am that morning. When we stopped at the front desk, the girl said she had said something to them but they just made fun of her and there was nothing she could do. I will never return to this dirty hotel again. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice, we had family reunion there with over 50 rooms”
Reviews.Author: JRK1
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms with there sales manager Tina Jirava on the toll free number [-]. We booked our Kindel Family Reunion at the hotel, we had over 200 people come, and meet all of our family members in the banquet area, it was fantastic. We all loved how big the hotel rooms were plus great price. They are remodeling the hotel to make it look even better, we saw signs that said remodel in progress is the only reason our family reunion knew. We would high recommend this hotel to anyone. Justin Kindel

Reviews.Title: “Most dirtly and bad service hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Dalls
Reviews.Content: The pool and hot tub area was even more of a treat had a fair bit of dirt on the bottom. They cleaning room evry other day according to the hotel manger (Patel). Our first day of stay, the hotel hav not hot water. no preckfast, Persons work in the hotel are not behave frindly with guest, According to Manager : This is our servece. if you dont like it just you can leave. With a doubt the worst customer service experience I've had I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so 'Grand'”
Reviews.Author: homersimp1210
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this establishment, and I arranged to meet my wife there. I arrived about 15 minutes early and checked in. She arrived about 15 minutes late and we went up to the room. Empty cigarette pack, unemptied ashtray, and soft drink can on the table. Full trash can. Ironing board and iron out. Bed slightly unmade. 2.5-inch roach (not counting antennae) scaling the wall. Wife asked me what that was, she didn't know they made roaches that big. We went back down to the desk, explained the situation to the "lady", and asked for a different room. No, it had been awhile since I checked in. I could have messed up the room myself. And Tyrannosaurus Roach? No response. I asked to speak to her manager. No response. But she's going to call security. With a doubt the worst customer service experience I've had at a hotel in my 50 years. We went next door to the La Quinta and I'll block the credit card charge tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Most disgustingly dirtly hotel I have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: msimon71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hotel for a seminar this past weekend. I really wished I had asked to see a room before I paid for the room...it was awful. After walking in the door, I was greeted with a musty odor and old/worn out decor. I figured that they were refurbishing, so I'd give them a try. I checked in to my room, (after paying the entire weekend stay up front...I should have known) and realized that several of the lights in the room didn't work, there were holes in the walls, missing fire detectors, etc. The room was mostly clean with a new bed, and the bathroom was old but decent. The conference facility was more displeasing than my room. It was filthy, had a terrible smell (mold, anyone?) and had buckets on the floor to collect the water dripping from the ceiling. I was there for a martial arts seminar, and many people were in bare feet for training. Their feet were filthy w/in around 30 minutes. I'm told the floor was "sticky." I had shoes that had previously been new and bright white. By the end of the day, they were black around the edges and the bottom. Yuck. The "security" doors at the end of each hallway never locked, so I was never really comfortable there, but at least I never needed to worry about locking myself out of the hotel. The pool and hot tub area was even more of a treat. The hot tub water was pitch black with floaters in it. I'm not sure what they were. I didn't even look too much at the pool because I could see from inside the hotel that it had a fair bit of dirt on the bottom. I would never stay at this hotel again. If I hadn't wanted to waste the money I spent, I would have stayed at the La Quinta (an additional $10/night) or the Crown Plaza ($30 more). Looking back, I probably should have. Don't waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ahs96gne
Reviews.Content: Eight co-workers and I stayed for two weeks at the Harvey Hotel in Dallas recently. Here are the high and low lights: 1) Restaurant was good as long as you can order from the bar menu as well as the regular menu. 2) Bar was good and most of the bar/restaurant wait staff very good. 3) Room was clean and the beds comfortable. 4) Breakfast was wonderful. Now, the bad: 1) Hotel construction/renovation made spending any time in the rooms between 10:00am and 6:00pm, 7 days per week, nearly impossible. 2) Hotel website stated "free internet". When we inquired about it, instead of receiving free internet access, management changed the website! 3) Water pressure in the shower was awful. 4) One co-worker was locked IN HIS ROOM not once, but twice! Lock failure was the culprit. 5) We were promised (via PowerPoint presentation) that there would be the following in each room: 32" plasma screen TV, cotton robes, skin care products, and industry-leading bedding, none of which was present. I could go on. Overall, not a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't really care about their guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the past couple years, I have stayed at the Harvey Hotel 3 times a year during the local NASCAR races at TMS. For me this has been clearly a vacation trip. During the past two stays I have had the unfortunate experience of staying in a room that was preceded by a person having set the alarm clock for 6:00am on an alarm clock where off does not mean off. The first time this happened, I mentioned it to the front desk clerk and he informed me that their procedure was for the maids to confirm the alarm clocks are turned off after each guest and that my experience was simply an oversight. The very next stay, the exact thing happened again, 6:00am the alarm clock is blaring at me after getting less than 4 hours sleep. I'm now up for the day and feel horrible the rest of that day. After pulling the power cord on the alarm clock, you would think the problem was solved. The very next morning, the backup battery assured that I was again woken at 6:00am. As this point, I'm absolutely outraged at Harvey Hotels. Again after speaking with the manager on duty, I am given the same apology and excuse that it was a simple oversight. I say it's a clear pattern. I insisted that I was not going to pay a full rate to sleep in a hotel that does not allow me to sleep. His compensation to me was $15.00 for each of the two of us in the room for two sleepless nights. That's $7.50 per person per sleepless night. Harvey Hotel clearly does not care about their guest and I will not stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Harvey Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Harvey Hotel in Dallas/Ft. Worth for a convention. Our classes were at the hotel and the hotel was recommended by the orginazation presenting the classes. I can see why now! Wow what a great hotel! The minute I walked in I was amazed. The staff was very friendly. The shuttles to and from local areas for a small fee was convenient. The food and drinks from the bar and restraunts was great. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. In my opinion the best part was the conveniences such as the exercise room and swimming pool and hot tub. I loved the view from up there. I would definately recommend this hotel, and if I return, I know where I will be staying!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Harvey”
Reviews.Author: ursirius
Reviews.Content: Due to a mechanical failure of our airplane, we had to stay over in Dallas and were sent to the Harvey by the airline. After having been in a bad choice of hotel in New-Orleans, this was just absolutely magic. Reception worked quickly and efficiently to accommodate the sudden influx of all the stranded. Asking for a toothbrush, we got them plus other important tidbits. The room was lovely, noisy location but who cared, all we wanted was to sleep. Will gladly go back, just not stay on the 3 floor facing the back.Thanks.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 7815 LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75251 (Formerly Grand Hotel Dallas)
